title: How to Send an Email to Any Phone Number as a Text

steps.title: Find the domain for the carrier.
steps.content: Find the domain for the carrier. This will differ depending on the carrier. You can use the Email2SMS website to check. Go to https://email2sms.info/ in a web browser. Click the Country drop-down menu and select the country. Enter the carrier in the Carrier field. Take note of the domain. In some cases, you'll see several different options which pertain to subcategories of a carrier. These options will usually all have the same address.

steps.title: Open your email program or website.
steps.content: Open your email program or website. You can send email messages to cell phones using most email apps or sites, like Outlook , Gmail , or Yahoo Mail .

steps.title: Open a new email message.
steps.content: Open a new email message . Click the Compose , New , or ï¼‹ icon to do so. A new message window or page should pop up. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Address the recipient in the "To" field.
steps.content: Address the recipient in the "To" field. Type their mobile phone number without the country code or any punctuation followed by the carrier's mobile email domain. For example, to email the U.S. number (123) 456-7890 using Verizon, you would address the message to 1234567890@vtext.com . [2] X Research source You can add a subject in the "Subject" line, but doing so is unnecessary, and may not be supported by your recipient's carrier.

steps.title: Enter your message.
steps.content: Enter your message. In the main text area of the message window, type in the text message that you want to send. Remember, this must be at or below 160 characters in length.

steps.title: Send the message.
steps.content: Send the message. Click the Send or icon to do so. Your recipient should receive your email message after a few moments in their messaging app. If you send more than 160 characters at once, some carriers will deliver the message as two or more separate messages, while other carriers simply won't deliver any text after the 160th character.
